definitions.text: building material used as siding or roofing
frothy drink of milk and flavoring and sometimes fruit or ice cream
a note that alternates rapidly with another note a semitone above it
grasping and shaking a person's hand (as to acknowledge an introduction or to agree on a contract)
a reflex motion caused by cold or fear or excitement
causing to move repeatedly from side to side
move or cause to move back and forth
examples: The chemist shook the flask vigorously

definitions.text: move with or as if with a tremor
shake or vibrate rapidly and intensively
move back and forth or sideways
examples: She rocked back and forth on her feet
The bad news shook her hopes

definitions.text: stir the feelings, emotions, or peace of
examples: the civil war shook the country
I couldn't shake the car that was following me

definitions.text: bring to a specified condition by or as if by shaking
examples: He was shaken from his dreams
shake the salt out of the salt shaker

definitions.text: shake (a body part) to communicate a greeting, feeling, or cognitive state
examples: She shook her finger at the naughty students
Don't shake your fist at me!
